European Parliamentary Financial Services Forum: 
Burkhard Eckes, PwC Germany
eu_initiatives:
At PwC, we find it important  to play a constructive role in the debates shaping auditing, financial reporting, tax legislation and corporate governance around the world. We see our role as one to help inform the debate, bring our expertise and perspectives to the table, and ask questions to help advance discussions. 
More details can be found on the following pages: 
 
PwC Global Public Policy & Regulatory Affairs website: 
https://www.pwc.com/gx/en/about/global-regulatory-affairs.html 
PwC Global tax policy & administration: 
https://www.pwc.com/gx/en/services/tax/tax-policy-administration.html 
  
One of our most recent contributions was to the EC fitness check on public corporate reporting by companies: 
https://www.pwc.com/gx/en/about/assets/pwc-response-fitness-check-reporting.pdf
source: EU Financial Transparency System (2016): http://ec.europa.eu/budget/fts/index_en.htm and EP contracts awarded: http://www.europarl.europa.eu/contracts-and-grants/en/20150201PVL00099/Contracts-awarded

legal_status: PwC is the brand under which the member firms of PricewaterhouseCoopers International Limited (PwCIL) operate and provide professional services. Together, these firms form the PwC network. ‘PwC’ is often used to refer either to individual firms within the
customers: European Business Initiative on Taxation. PwC is not a member of EBIT. EBIT is facilitated by PwC, which only acts as Secretariat (www.ebit-businesstax.com)
goals__remit: At PwC, our purpose is to build trust in society and solve important problems. We’re a network of firms in 158 countries with over 250,000 people who are committed to delivering quality in assurance, advisory and tax services. Find out more and tell us what matters to you by visiting us at www.pwc.com
